citation.article-title: Flavobacterium rivuli sp. nov., Flavobacterium subsaxonicum sp. nov., Flavobacterium swingsii sp. nov. and Flavobacterium reichenbachii sp. nov., isolated from a hard water rivulet
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium rivuli sp. nov.
Flavobacterium rivuli (ri′vu.li. L. gen. n. rivuli of/from a small river).
Gram-staining-negative (KOH and aminopeptidase reactions positive), aerobic and microaerobic rods (0.4–0.6×1.5–2.5 μm).
Does not grow anaerobically.
Growth occurs between 4 and 29 °C with an optimal temperature between 16 and 24 °C.
Growth between 4 and 8 °C is sparse; no growth occurs below 4 °C or above 29 °C.
Growth occurs between pH 6.4 and 7.8 with an optimal pH of 7.0.
Growth occurs at NaCl concentrations between 0 and 2 % (w/v) with optimal growth at 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Gliding motility and flagella are absent.
Colonies on R2A, NA, TSA and CY agars are circular with entire margins, convex, smooth, translucent, soft and butyrous.
Colonies are pearl white on R2A and CY agars and yellow on TSA and NA agars.
Colonies are 2–2.5 mm in diameter on R2A agar and 0.3–0.8 mm on NA, TSA and CY agars.
Flexirubin pigments are absent.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Nitrate reduction is negative.
Aesculin and glycogen hydrolysis are positive; cellulose (Whatman No. 1), chitin and gelatin hydrolysis are negative.
Other physiological reactions are given in Table 1.
The major fatty acids (>7.5 % of total) are iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0 and summed feature 3 (comprising C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH).
The type strain, WB 3.3-2T (=DSM 21788T=CIP 109865T), was isolated from a spring of Westerhöfer Bach, Westerhof, 40 km north of Göttingen, Germany.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 40.4 mol%.
